<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/21/biggest-troll-move-new-variant-arriving-every-time-we-try-to-return-to-the-office?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Biggest Troll Move: New Variant Arriving Every Time We Try to Return to the Office
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/21/biggest-troll-move-new-variant-arriving-every-time-we-try-to-return-to-the-office?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Laptop on award template" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/dc1484babbbc61959c75549f1b54d3da4cdea47c-1920x1080.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em><em>Dianna “Mick” McDougall; Getty Images</em></em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While there’s nothing particularly amusing about the coronavirus unleashing a new variant every time we get our laptop bag organized, the timing’s uncanny. Many companies, including Google and Morgan Stanley, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/28/delta-variant-puts-breaks-return-office?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">had marked</a> Labor Day as their official return-to-office date following a long stretch of remote work. Poetic, but not prophetic: The Delta variant surged across the US in the summer, forcing many companies to postpone their plans to bring workers back into the office.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In our own survey conducted in August, 47% of respondents said they were </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/13/delta-upends-backtowork-plans-morning-brew-survey?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reconsidering</a></span><span> a return to the office because of the spread of the Delta variant.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of mid-December, Delta was estimated to account for 96% of all Covid-19 cases in the US. But now there’s a new deputy in town, Omicron, and the highly mutated and contagious variant <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/omicron-variant-accounts-73-percent-new-covid-cases-us-rcna9434?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made up</a> 73% of cases as of Dec. 17 and is once again thwarting Corporate America’s grand office return this winter.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meta, Ford, Alphabet, and Lyft have all <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/companies-upend-plans-on-covid-19-vaccines-and-office-returns-again-11639321203?mod=hp_lead_pos4" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pushed back</a> their return-to-office dates in recent weeks due to Omicron. An exasperated Apple, when informing employees of its own office postponement earlier this month, basically said, “You know what, let's just not put a date on it anymore,” and put its return to office on <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/15/technology/apple-return-to-work.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">indefinite hold</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Execs who hyped in-person work earlier in the pandemic are starting to realize that a remote arrangement may be more sticky than they had thought. Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman recently said he was “wrong” to pressure employees to come back to the office by Labor Day, acknowledging that “everybody’s still finding their way” during the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One major factor influencing return-to-work decisions is the ability to attract and retain employees in this extremely tight labor market. Fact is, many employees <em>want </em>the flexibility to work remotely, and companies that insist on making workers trudge into the office will find themselves at a disadvantage when hiring.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to a <a href="https://wfhresearch.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/WFHResearch_updates_November2021.pdf?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">November survey</a> of US residents conducted by top remote work researchers, 39% of college grads who quit a job in the past six months said they quit to increase their ability to WFH.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">-----</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner-up: Ken Griffin outbidding crypto investors to buy a copy of the Constitution.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last month, a group of crypto investors <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/crypto-investors-want-to-buy-the-constitution?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">created a DAO</a> (decentralized autonomous organization) and raised over $40 million in ethereum. Their goal: Buy a rare copy of the US Constitution at auction. In the same way that the US Constitution put governance in the hands of “the people,” the movement was seen as a symbol of how blockchain technology can empower individuals.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Enter Ken Griffin—a hedge fund billionaire and frequent target of Reddit traders, who see him as a symbol of everything that’s wrong with Wall Street. He outbid the DAO to buy the document for $43.2 million, <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/currencies/constitutiondao-raises-46-million-buy-rare-copy-us-constitution-auction-2021-11?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than double</a> the amount Sotheby’s originally thought it would fetch.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner-up: Taylor Swift releasing a re-recorded album.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Swifties rejoiced this year when the breakup queen herself released <em>Red (Taylor’s Version)</em>, a re-recording of her 2012 hepta-platinum album of the same name. Swift’s move is all about regaining <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/12/taylor-swift-s-new-album-dropped-and-record-companies-are-a-little-nervous?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">financial control</a> of her music after her masters, or original recordings, were bought and sold by investment firms.</p>
</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PEOPLE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/most-consequential-person-elon-musk?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Most Consequential Person: Elon Musk
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/most-consequential-person-elon-musk?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Elon Musk as the most consequential person " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/b23b62c53cbc6562e5fad5ad426ba45eb010e92f-1920x1080.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Dianna “Mick” McDougall; Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This year, Elon Musk…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tanked dogecoin when he hosted </span><span><em>SNL</em></span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Led Tesla to a $1 trillion market capitalization</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Launched the first crewed mission to space without professional astronauts</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tweeted, “I keep forgetting that you’re still alive” to Sen. Bernie Sanders</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Wrote many other rude jokes on Twitter</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Became the first person to have a net worth above $300 billion</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Moved Tesla's HQ from California to Texas</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sold $15 billion worth of Tesla stock after polling Twitter users</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Was ordered to pay a Black Tesla employee $137 million over racial discrimination at the workplace</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Attacked President Biden’s Build Back Better plan and argued against EV subsidies</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Launched almost 900 broadband satellites through SpaceX’s Starlink program</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>…and a lot more</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2021 showcased the best and worst of Elon Musk, who is a fusion of business mogul and celebrity we haven’t seen in generations. His big bet with Tesla has been vindicated—it’s the most valuable automaker by a longshot, and other car manufacturers are spending tens of billions on EVs to catch up. One of his other ventures, SpaceX, is the clear leader in the burgeoning market for space tourists and enterprises.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yet Musk’s antics—from trolling tweets to pumping memecoins to sparring with lawmakers—are off-putting to many people and threaten to overshadow his otherwise invaluable contributions to society. Tesla has also been the subject of numerous <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/autos/tesla-drivers-can-play-video-games-driving-federal-safety-regulators-a-rcna8381?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">regulatory probes</a> into the safety of its vehicles:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In August, federal auto safety authorities began investigating 11 crashes involving Tesla cars that allegedly struck stationary first-responder vehicles while the company’s Autopilot software was engaged.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Facing heat from regulators, Tesla pulled an update that allows video games to be played on the vehicle’s main touchscreen while the car is in motion.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>We can probably assume Musk will remain one of the most consequential figures in the years to come—unless, that is, he decides to <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1469153995428085762?lang=en" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quit his jobs</a> and become an influencer.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">-----</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner up: Joe Biden</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The longtime Democratic senator and former VP was sworn in on Jan. 20 and has accomplished a good chunk of his priorities this year, including signing a bipartisan infrastructure bill into law, rejoining the Paris climate agreement, and overseeing a rapid economic recovery. Yet his declaration on July 4 that the US had achieved “independence” from Covid-19 seems extremely premature in hindsight: More people in the US died from the virus in 2021 than in all of 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner up: Simone Biles</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Simone Biles, the gymnastics GOAT, shocked the world when she pulled herself out of competition at the Tokyo Olympics this summer due to mental health concerns. Her actions sparked reflection around the intense scrutiny faced by young athletes, “because at the end of the day, we’re human too,” Biles said.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="#">
<font color="#000000">
Resolve to Diversify

</a>
</h1>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As we head into a new year, you may be looking to kickstart some new habits for a “better you” in 2022. If you’ve made a resolution to get financially fit, you may want to think about portfolio diversification that will help you grow your wealth far into the future. </p>

All you need to do is track your progress through the Fundrise app.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s a resolution that’s tough to break, with benefits that last beyond 2022. For a limited time,<strong style="color:#000"> Fundrise is even offering new investors an additional $10</strong> after they place their first investment.* So start building a better portfolio today. <a href="https://fundrise.com/campaigns/starter-promo?utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=newsletter-morningbrew-20211229promo&utm_content=Fundrise_is_Real_Estate---promo_10_usd" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Your future self will thank you</a>.</p>

<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SNAPSHOTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/image-of-the-year-the-capitol-insurrection?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Image of the Year: The Capitol Insurrection
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/image-of-the-year-the-capitol-insurrection?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="The QAnon Shaman in the Capitol building" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/21093d05fc5d2a6466451dae59300a5936581695-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Win McNamee/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You probably will never forget where you were on January 6, when a mob of Trump supporters breached the Capitol building in an attempt to overturn his defeat in the 2020 US presidential election. The event is considered one of the greatest threats to democracy in the country’s history, and it highlighted the fragility of our democratic institutions amid an onslaught of misinformation and conspiracy theories pushed by the former president and his allies.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to a Reuters/Ipsos poll from May, <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2021/05/25/poll-quarter-americans-surveyed-say-trump-true-president/7426714002/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">25% of Americans</a> and 53% of Republicans believed that Donald Trump was the “true president” despite virtually no evidence of voter fraud during the last election.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">-----</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner up: The Ever Given gets stuck in the Suez Canal </strong></p>
<img class="img-responsive" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/8e9265b2b10fcae0fb0a7c422c4b01c28fcae3f3-1024x676.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format" alt="An overhead image of the Ever Given stuck in the Suez Canal" style="display:block;width:100% !important"><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Satellite image (c) 2021 Maxar Technologies</em></small></span><p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The writers of 2021 had a really good time with this plot line. One of the world’s largest cargo ships, the Ever Given, got stuck in the Suez Canal in March for six days, throttling traffic in a critical trade route and adding another element of chaos to already discombobulated supply chains.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But as we try to reset and correct past mistakes for the new year, maybe we can learn a thing or two from the Ever Given: It successfully navigated the Suez Canal earlier this month in its first attempt since its public humiliation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner up: Covid memorial in Washington, DC</strong></p>
<img class="img-responsive" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7f57d1b4aa03a1efbc53fd9b48253cf50b79033c-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format" alt="Flags planted in DC to remember the lives lost due to Covid" style="display:block;width:100% !important"><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Kent Nishimura / Los Angeles Times via Getty Images</em></small></span><p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">650,000+ white flags were planted on the National Mall in September to remember the lives lost due to Covid in the US. More than 800,000 Americans have now died of Covid-19, with 75% of the deaths occurring among people 65 and older. 5.3 million have died globally.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Toxicology = the study of poisons</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plutology = the study of wealth</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mycology = the study of fungi</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Anemology = the study of winds</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Potamology = the study of rivers</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ophiology = the study of snakes</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Oology = the study of eggs, specifically birds’ eggs</span></li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/21/biggest-troll-move-new-variant-arriving-every-time-we-try-to-return-to-the-office?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBiggest Troll Move: New Variant Arriving Every Time We Try to Return to the Office\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/21/biggest-troll-move-new-variant-arriving-every-time-we-try-to-return-to-the-office?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Laptop on award template\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/dc1484babbbc61959c75549f1b54d3da4cdea47c-1920x1080.png?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cem\u003eDianna “Mick” McDougall; Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile there’s nothing particularly amusing about the coronavirus unleashing a new variant every time we get our laptop bag organized, the timing’s uncanny. Many companies, including Google and Morgan Stanley, \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/28/delta-variant-puts-breaks-return-office?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehad marked\u003c/a\u003e Labor Day as their official return-to-office date following a long stretch of remote work. Poetic, but not prophetic: The Delta variant surged across the US in the summer, forcing many companies to postpone their plans to bring workers back into the office.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn our own survey conducted in August, 47% of respondents said they were \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/13/delta-upends-backtowork-plans-morning-brew-survey?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereconsidering\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a return to the office because of the spread of the Delta variant.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs of mid-December, Delta was estimated to account for 96% of all Covid-19 cases in the US. But now there’s a new deputy in town, Omicron, and the highly mutated and contagious variant \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/omicron-variant-accounts-73-percent-new-covid-cases-us-rcna9434?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade up\u003c/a\u003e 73% of cases as of Dec. 17 and is once again thwarting Corporate America’s grand office return this winter.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeta, Ford, Alphabet, and Lyft have all \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/companies-upend-plans-on-covid-19-vaccines-and-office-returns-again-11639321203?mod=hp_lead_pos4\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epushed back\u003c/a\u003e their return-to-office dates in recent weeks due to Omicron. An exasperated Apple, when informing employees of its own office postponement earlier this month, basically said, “You know what, let's just not put a date on it anymore,” and put its return to office on \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/15/technology/apple-return-to-work.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eindefinite hold\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eExecs who hyped in-person work earlier in the pandemic are starting to realize that a remote arrangement may be more sticky than they had thought. Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman recently said he was “wrong” to pressure employees to come back to the office by Labor Day, acknowledging that “everybody’s still finding their way” during the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne major factor influencing return-to-work decisions is the ability to attract and retain employees in this extremely tight labor market. Fact is, many employees \u003cem\u003ewant \u003c/em\u003ethe flexibility to work remotely, and companies that insist on making workers trudge into the office will find themselves at a disadvantage when hiring.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to a \u003ca href=\"https://wfhresearch.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/WFHResearch_updates_November2021.pdf?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNovember survey\u003c/a\u003e of US residents conducted by top remote work researchers, 39% of college grads who quit a job in the past six months said they quit to increase their ability to WFH.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e-----\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRunner-up: Ken Griffin outbidding crypto investors to buy a copy of the Constitution.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast month, a group of crypto investors \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/crypto-investors-want-to-buy-the-constitution?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecreated a DAO\u003c/a\u003e (decentralized autonomous organization) and raised over $40 million in ethereum. Their goal: Buy a rare copy of the US Constitution at auction. In the same way that the US Constitution put governance in the hands of “the people,” the movement was seen as a symbol of how blockchain technology can empower individuals.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEnter Ken Griffin—a hedge fund billionaire and frequent target of Reddit traders, who see him as a symbol of everything that’s wrong with Wall Street. He outbid the DAO to buy the document for $43.2 million, \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/currencies/constitutiondao-raises-46-million-buy-rare-copy-us-constitution-auction-2021-11?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than double\u003c/a\u003e the amount Sotheby’s originally thought it would fetch.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRunner-up: Taylor Swift releasing a re-recorded album.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSwifties rejoiced this year when the breakup queen herself released \u003cem\u003eRed (Taylor’s Version)\u003c/em\u003e, a re-recording of her 2012 hepta-platinum album of the same name. Swift’s move is all about regaining \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/12/taylor-swift-s-new-album-dropped-and-record-companies-are-a-little-nervous?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinancial control\u003c/a\u003e of her music after her masters, or original recordings, were bought and sold by investment firms.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis year, Elon Musk…\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTanked dogecoin when he hosted \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eSNL\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLed Tesla to a $1 trillion market capitalization\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLaunched the first crewed mission to space without professional astronauts\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTweeted, “I keep forgetting that you’re still alive” to Sen. Bernie Sanders\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWrote many other rude jokes on Twitter\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBecame the first person to have a net worth above $300 billion\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMoved Tesla's HQ from California to Texas\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSold $15 billion worth of Tesla stock after polling Twitter users\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWas ordered to pay a Black Tesla employee $137 million over racial discrimination at the workplace\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAttacked President Biden’s Build Back Better plan and argued against EV subsidies\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLaunched almost 900 broadband satellites through SpaceX’s Starlink program\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e…and a lot more\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2021 showcased the best and worst of Elon Musk, who is a fusion of business mogul and celebrity we haven’t seen in generations. His big bet with Tesla has been vindicated—it’s the most valuable automaker by a longshot, and other car manufacturers are spending tens of billions on EVs to catch up. One of his other ventures, SpaceX, is the clear leader in the burgeoning market for space tourists and enterprises.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYet Musk’s antics—from trolling tweets to pumping memecoins to sparring with lawmakers—are off-putting to many people and threaten to overshadow his otherwise invaluable contributions to society. Tesla has also been the subject of numerous \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/autos/tesla-drivers-can-play-video-games-driving-federal-safety-regulators-a-rcna8381?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eregulatory probes\u003c/a\u003e into the safety of its vehicles:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn August, federal auto safety authorities began investigating 11 crashes involving Tesla cars that allegedly struck stationary first-responder vehicles while the company’s Autopilot software was engaged.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFacing heat from regulators, Tesla pulled an update that allows video games to be played on the vehicle’s main touchscreen while the car is in motion.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWe can probably assume Musk will remain one of the most consequential figures in the years to come—unless, that is, he decides to \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1469153995428085762?lang=en\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equit his jobs\u003c/a\u003e and become an influencer.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e-----\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRunner up: Joe Biden\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe longtime Democratic senator and former VP was sworn in on Jan. 20 and has accomplished a good chunk of his priorities this year, including signing a bipartisan infrastructure bill into law, rejoining the Paris climate agreement, and overseeing a rapid economic recovery. Yet his declaration on July 4 that the US had achieved “independence” from Covid-19 seems extremely premature in hindsight: More people in the US died from the virus in 2021 than in all of 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRunner up: Simone Biles\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSimone Biles, the gymnastics GOAT, shocked the world when she pulled herself out of competition at the Tokyo Olympics this summer due to mental health concerns. Her actions sparked reflection around the intense scrutiny faced by young athletes, “because at the end of the day, we’re human too,” Biles color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nImage of the Year: The Capitol Insurrection\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eWin McNamee/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou probably will never forget where you were on January 6, when a mob of Trump supporters breached the Capitol building in an attempt to overturn his defeat in the 2020 US presidential election. The event is considered one of the greatest threats to democracy in the country’s history, and it highlighted the fragility of our democratic institutions amid an onslaught of misinformation and conspiracy theories pushed by the former president and his allies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to a Reuters/Ipsos poll from May, \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2021/05/25/poll-quarter-americans-surveyed-say-trump-true-president/7426714002/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e25% of Americans\u003c/a\u003e and 53% of Republicans believed that Donald Trump was the “true president” despite virtually no evidence of voter fraud during the last election.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e-----\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRunner up: The Ever Given gets stuck in the Suez Canal \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"img-responsive\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/8e9265b2b10fcae0fb0a7c422c4b01c28fcae3f3-1024x676.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\" alt=\"An overhead image of the Ever Given stuck in the Suez Canal\" style=\"display:block;width:100% !important\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eSatellite image (c) 2021 Maxar Technologies\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe writers of 2021 had a really good time with this plot line. One of the world’s largest cargo ships, the Ever Given, got stuck in the Suez Canal in March for six days, throttling traffic in a critical trade route and adding another element of chaos to already discombobulated supply chains.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut as we try to reset and correct past mistakes for the new year, maybe we can learn a thing or two from the Ever Given: It successfully navigated the Suez Canal earlier this month in its first attempt since its public humiliation.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRunner up: Covid memorial in Washington, DC\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"img-responsive\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7f57d1b4aa03a1efbc53fd9b48253cf50b79033c-1024x683.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\" alt=\"Flags planted in DC to remember the lives lost due to Covid\" style=\"display:block;width:100% !important\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eKent Nishimura / Los Angeles Times via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e650,000+ white flags were planted on the National Mall in September to remember the lives lost due to Covid in the US. More than 800,000 Americans have now died of Covid-19, with 75% of the deaths occurring among people 65 and older. 5.3 million have died globally.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/image-of-the-year-the-capitol-insurrection\u0026utm_source=facebook_share\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
